text: Fire alarm system design and one-line diagram reviewed and approved
System classification (NFPA 72) and code compliance (local authority) verified
Notification appliances, detection devices, and control panel specifications confirmed
Fire alarm control panel (FACP) installed in accessible, ventilated location with proper seismic anchorage
Wiring installed per code, securely fastened, and properly tagged
Fire alarm devices (detectors, pull stations, horns, strobes) installed in proper locations as per design
Manual pull stations mounted at proper height, with clear labeling and unobstructed access
Smoke and heat detectors located and installed per NFPA and manufacturer specifications
Interconnection between fire alarm control panel and HVAC, elevators, lighting systems verified
Emergency power supply (UPS or generator) for fire alarm panel confirmed and tested
Circuiting for notification and detection devices confirmed, polarity checked
System tested for all alarm conditions (smoke, heat, manual, supervisory)
Notification devices activated and verified for adequate coverage (audible and visible alarms)
Signal integrity, communication with monitoring station (if applicable) tested
Final alarm test (with fire department coordination, if necessary) completed and signed off
As-built drawings, system schematics, and point-to-point test logs submitted
Operator training completed, with system manual and emergency procedures provided

id: • NFPA 72, NFPA 101, CSA C22.1 (CEC), UL 864, IBC 2018, NBC 2019
